subject: Climate & Environment
title: Phytoplankton: The Invisible Powerhouse
description: A short lesson to help you apply Phytoplankton: The Invisible Powerhouse.

hook.text: Phytoplankton are microscopic. Yet they produce more oxygen than all the forests on Earth combined.

buildup.text: These tiny algae float near the surface, using sunlight and COâ‚‚ to grow through photosynthesis.

discovery.text: When they die, some sink to the deep ocean, locking carbon away for centuries â€” the biological pump.

twist.text: Phytoplankton populations have declined 40% since 1950 as ocean temperatures have risen.

climax.text: Losing phytoplankton means less oxygen, less carbon storage, and a collapsing marine food chain.

punchline.text: The creatures you can't see are the ones keeping you alive.
